predictions.text: The UN Security Council will hold (and publish an official meeting record for) an emergency meeting specifically focused on the U.S. operation in Venezuela and the capture/detention of Nicolás Maduro, by 2026-02-15 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: UN Security Council meeting listed on the official UN meetings calendar and/or an official UN document page (e.g., S/PV.####) showing the meeting occurred by the deadline, with agenda/topic explicitly referencing Venezuela and the U.S. operation/capture of Maduro.
evidence: Maduro pleads not guilty and frames himself as a “prisoner of war,” increasing international diplomatic/legal salience: https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/05/venezuela-maduro-court-trump.html
Great-power escalation framing raises likelihood of UN-level discussion: https://www.nytimes.com/2026/01/05/world/europe/trump-venezuela-china-russia.html
monitoring_signals: UNSC program of work updates mentioning Venezuela
Requests for UNSC emergency sessions by Russia/China or Latin American members
UN press stakeouts by UNSC president or permanent members referencing Venezuela
predictions.rationale: High-profile capture/detention of a sitting head of state commonly triggers UNSC discussion even absent binding action; procedural meeting is easier than passing a resolution.

predictions.text: The European Commission will open a formal Digital Services Act (DSA) proceeding/investigation against X (Twitter) that explicitly references AI-generated child sexual abuse material (CSAM) or sexualized deepfakes produced via Grok/xAI, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A Commission (or designated DSA Digital Services Coordinator acting within the DSA framework) press release/notice announces formal proceedings under the DSA against X, and the notice explicitly cites Grok/xAI-generated CSAM and/or sexualized deepfakes as part of the alleged noncompliance.
evidence: Multi-jurisdiction probes into X after Grok generated explicit deepfakes increase EU scrutiny likelihood: https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/05/india-eu-investigate-musks-x-after-grok-created-deepfake-child-porn.html
monitoring_signals: EU Commission DSA press releases naming X
Statements by Thierry Breton’s successor team / DG CONNECT about generative AI harms
EU DSAs Coordinator referrals or coordinated actions mentioning CSAM/deepfakes
predictions.rationale: EU has both political pressure and a clear regulatory pathway; opening proceedings is a lower bar than final penalties.

predictions.text: NetBlocks (or an equivalent widely cited monitoring group such as Cloudflare Radar) will report a Venezuela-wide internet connectivity disruption of at least 50% lasting 12+ consecutive hours, by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A public report/graph from NetBlocks or Cloudflare Radar (or similarly cited global monitoring organization) indicates nationwide Venezuela connectivity down ≥50% versus baseline for ≥12 consecutive hours within the horizon, and major media attribute it to crisis/unrest/security measures or grid failure.
evidence: Venezuela crisis has already manifested as routing instability/BGP anomalies during blackout periods: https://loworbitsecurity.com/radar/radar16/
monitoring_signals: Cloudflare Radar country-level traffic anomalies for VE
NetBlocks alerts referencing Venezuela
Reports of grid instability or fuel shortages affecting telecom backhaul
predictions.rationale: Political instability plus grid fragility makes additional nationwide disruptions plausible; the threshold is moderate (12h, 50%).

predictions.text: ICE Brent front-month will settle at or above $95.00/bbl on at least one trading day, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: ICE published settlement price for Brent front-month is ≥ $95.00 per barrel for at least one trading day on or before the deadline.
evidence: Venezuela upheaval is adding an oil risk premium and uncertainty around export continuity: https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/05/market-sees-chevron-the-big-venezuela-winner-but-oil-majors-face-a-long-road.html
monitoring_signals: Monthly Kpler/Vortexa export estimates for Venezuela and disruptions
OPEC+ policy statements and compliance
Red Sea security incidents and shipping insurance rates
predictions.rationale: Given elevated geopolitical risk premia and supply uncertainty, a brief spike to $95 is plausible even if sustained prices are not.

predictions.text: At least one major container carrier (Maersk, MSC, CMA CGM, Hapag-Lloyd, or ONE) will publicly announce a resumption of routine Bab el-Mandeb/Red Sea transits after previously avoiding/suspending the route for 30+ consecutive days due to security risk, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Carrier press release/official advisory (or Reuters/Bloomberg/FT/WSJ report citing the carrier) states the company is resuming routine Red Sea/Bab el-Mandeb transits; prior avoidance/suspension for ≥30 consecutive days is documented in their advisories or credible reporting.
evidence: Ongoing security-driven transit decisions in the region remain central to shipping operations (context for resumption/avoidance dynamics).
monitoring_signals: Carrier routing advisories and security updates
UKMTO incident bulletins and maritime insurance war-risk premiums
AIS-based route share changes for major carriers
predictions.rationale: Firms often attempt partial resumptions when risk premiums stabilize; resumption announcements are common even if later reversed.

predictions.text: BOEM (or the U.S. Department of the Interior) will publish new or revised financial assurance/bonding guidance for offshore wind that materially increases required bonding/guarantees (e.g., explicit higher per-MW or per-project security requirements) for at least one permitting stage, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A BOEM/Interior memo, guidance document, or Federal Register notice is published by the deadline and explicitly raises offshore-wind financial assurance/bonding requirements (or introduces a new required security instrument) relative to prior guidance for at least one stage (lease, COP approval, construction/operations).
evidence: Developers are suing after the U.S. halted a large offshore wind pipeline, increasing the chance of additional administrative tightening: https://techcrunch.com/2026/01/05/offshore-wind-developers-sue-trump-administration-for-halting-25b-in-projects/
monitoring_signals: BOEM guidance page updates and Federal Register offshore wind notices
Interior/BOEM stakeholder calls referencing “financial assurance”
Developer disclosures on increased bonding demands in filings
predictions.rationale: If permitting is politically constrained, regulators may shift toward financial-risk controls; guidance changes are an accessible lever versus wholesale rulemaking.

predictions.text: NHTSA will open a formal safety defect investigation (ODI) into a commercial driverless/robotaxi service operated in the U.S. (e.g., Waymo, Zoox, or similar) that cites a crash or near-miss incident occurring in 2026, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: NHTSA ODI posts a publicly viewable investigation entry (PE/EA) naming a company/vehicle system tied to a commercial driverless service, opened in 2026, and the ODI summary references a 2026 crash/incident as part of the investigative basis.
evidence: Robotaxi competition and deployments are expanding, raising regulatory and safety scrutiny: https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/05/nvidia-plans-to-test-a-robotaxi-service-in-2027-in-self-driving-push.html
monitoring_signals: NHTSA ODI investigation database updates
Local incident reports involving driverless vehicles
Company safety reports and recalls/voluntary software updates
predictions.rationale: As miles and service areas expand, incident probability rises; ODI openings are a common response even without severe injuries.

predictions.text: A top-3 U.S. pharmacy benefit manager (CVS Caremark, Express Scripts, or Optum Rx) will announce national formulary coverage (not just case-by-case exceptions) for Novo Nordisk’s oral GLP-1 obesity pill for chronic weight management, effective for at least one 2027 plan year offering, by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: PBM press release/formulary update or major outlet report (Reuters/Bloomberg/WSJ/FT) confirms the oral obesity GLP-1 is included as a covered formulary option for chronic weight management for at least one broad national plan offering, with effective date or plan year stated.
evidence: Novo Nordisk launched the first U.S. GLP-1 obesity pill, shifting competitive and payer dynamics: https://www.cnbc.com/2026/01/05/first-glp-1-pill-for-obesity-from-novo-nordisk-launches-in-the-us.html
monitoring_signals: PBM 2027 formulary previews and exclusions lists
Employer benefits announcements referencing oral GLP-1 coverage
Net price/rebate commentary in Novo earnings calls
predictions.rationale: Oral administration can broaden uptake; PBMs are likely to formalize coverage with strict utilization management as competition and rebate leverage rise.

predictions.text: NSIDC (or an equivalent authoritative source such as NOAA/NASA) will report that the 2026 Arctic sea-ice annual minimum extent ranks among the 5 lowest observed in the satellite record, by 2026-10-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: NSIDC/NOAA/NASA seasonal summary or dataset update published by the deadline states the 2026 minimum extent rank is 1st–5th lowest since the start of the satellite record (commonly 1979).
evidence: New climate research suggests weaker CO2 uptake by plants than assumed, increasing climate pressure and likelihood of extreme indicators (context for heightened monitoring): https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2026/01/260104202809.htm
monitoring_signals: NSIDC daily extent graphs and anomaly trajectories through summer 2026
Arctic surface temperature anomalies and ocean heat content reports
Summer circulation pattern outlooks (AO/NAO) affecting melt
predictions.rationale: Recent years cluster near record lows; top-5 ranking is a moderate threshold that remains plausible given ongoing warming and variability.
